article_title: The Program Continues As A Front For Unlawful Payments To Insurers

article_metadata.description: In a memorandum of February 12, 2016, the Center of Consumer Oversight and Insurance Oversight, part of the Obama administration, doubled down on its previous policy of taking billions of dollars that the Affordable Care Act should be paid into the United States Treasury and diverted it to private insurers writing policies on the Exchanges. There continues to be no legal justification for this diversion. The key questions are whether these unauthorized payments will lure insurers losing money on the Exchanges to continue to sell policies there and whether and how anyone either paying or receiving these funds will be held accountable.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
